items.text: The log format is minimal and effective for basic session tracking.
The session was very brief (3 minutes), indicating it was an initialization or setup session.
The log structure is consistent, using timestamps and clear intent statements.
The system uses a formal naming convention for goals (GOAL_ prefix).
Session followed a clear three-block structure (Cleanup, Lock-in, Build).
Discovery of full project scope (PCL) occurred during the 'build' phase, indicating initial planning was incomplete.
System was declared 'clean' at the end, suggesting a successful reset/org phase.
Work produced a significant git commit (51 files, 23,734 lines) indicating substantial file creation and reorganization.
Session demonstrates a rapid pivot from research to comprehensive product conception and specification.
User emphasizes action over endless tinkering ('Fuck tinkering endlessly in the build stage').
Process involves creating detailed specs and reusable systems (Design Workbench, motion lexicon) to accelerate future work.
Content strategy is designed to be derivative, repurposing core material (book) into multiple formats (posts, emails, webinars).
Tool building (page picker) was deprioritized when it produced overwhelming data; analysis before automation was needed.
Boilerplate analysis successfully scaled to 38 kits and 93 screens using a categorical approach.
Decisions on font stacks and kit roles were made based on specific aesthetic and functional criteria.
Session combined high-level architecture review with detailed inventory and component management.
Pattern: Initial AI tendency to invent/generate can conflict with user requirement for exact replication from a source (Figma).
Insight: The value shifts from building individual platforms to building the capability to build *any* platform (the factory).
Insight: Manual, repetitive tasks (frame-by-frame conversion) are a major bottleneck even with AI assistance; tool limitations dictate workflow.
Insight: Unstructured, expanding documentation becomes a liability for AI context; a structured, database-backed system is needed for scalability.
Session demonstrates rapid pivot from research to full specification based on identified market gap.
Process includes comprehensive competitor teardown, independent build strategy, and detailed sprint planning.
Outputs are systematically organized into the Build Factory and Knowledge Library structures.
Session successfully combined high-level system housekeeping with concrete project (Fitness App) development.
Pattern of correcting legacy documentation references (pillar count) to maintain a single source of truth.
Explicit decision to avoid large sprints ('death marches') for the Enterprise OS in favor of sustainable daily progress.
Session followed a clear phased plan leading to high productivity.
Bug fixing was iterative and immediate, resolving issues as they arose.
Dual Python environments are a recurring source of installation issues.
Creating comprehensive LLM context guides significantly boosts operational efficiency for future sessions.
Data quality from automated analyses (like OCR) must be validated before trust.
Working in 2-hour bouts with clear objectives is an effective discipline being established.
Pattern: Recognizing a foundational bottleneck (manual conversion) led to a major strategic pivot (factory-first).
Insight: Investing time in building a scalable factory system upfront saves orders of magnitude more time later across multiple projects.
Process Insight: Session summaries effectively capture decisions, progress, and next steps, enabling clear continuity.
The session was highly efficient, completing the core file creation for a major infrastructure version in 6 minutes.
Work was logged with precise timestamps and file paths, indicating a structured development process.
Technical insight: Figma API full tree pull is a game changer; one request per kit gets everything.
Technical insight: Screens can be typed as COMPONENT or INSTANCE; must classify by dimensions.
Technical insight: Layout detection works mechanically without AI.
Technical insight: Deduplication ratio varies by kit type (fitness apps high reuse, marketing kits low).
Process insight: Documenting methodology as canon is critical to prevent context loss and repeated work.
Process insight: System adherence is a recurring challenge: 'we don't fucking stick to [the system] for five minutes'.
Process insight: Session logging in dual locations is part of protocol but needs enforcement.
Built entire infrastructure layer in a single session (~14:00 to late evening).
Emphasis on local execution with zero LLM token cost.
Safety-first approach with copy-never-move consolidation.
Daily habit established to integrate the new tools into workflow.
Spent day building tools but not following session logging/indexing/rules that make the system work.
Need to balance tool building with system discipline.
JSON-first, mechanical parsing proved effective and cost-free compared to AI vision.
Session followed a structured wrap-up pattern, culminating in an automated log file.
Emphasis on creating both machine-readable (scripts, manifests) and human-readable (guides) artifacts.
Batch processing benefits from having fallback strategies (section fetch, node extraction) for API failures.
Keeping master index files (KIT_INDEX, CHECKPOINT) synchronized is critical for tracking pipeline state.
Rate limits are a predictable blocker for bulk export operations; scheduling retries is necessary.
Building tools before analysis leads to wasted effort (page picker tool deprecated).
Capturing and retaining context from prior sessions is critical to avoid user frustration and rework.
User prefers super focused, targeted work over broad browsing or overwhelming choice sets.
Pivoting based on user feedback (from tool-building to analysis) was effective in progressing the work.
Detailed logging of specifications (kit roles logged three times as requested) is necessary for alignment.
Analysis-first approach (coverage mapping) provides a scaffold for efficient, targeted selection.
